info.description:
Employee Self-Service (ESS) for Scheduling automates schedule processes to collect employee input, and reduces the time spent by managers in sorting, correcting, and posting final schedules. Employees use the features to request changes to their current schedules.

Refer to the [Scheduling overview](doc:scheduling-overview-doc) topic in [Domain overviews](doc:domain-overviews-doc) for more information.
info.title: Employee Self-Service

tags.description:
From here you may browse our library of API resources, organized hierarchically by domain, or major functional area, logical subgroup, API resource, and all available operations against that resource. For more information about the concepts and technology behind our API, refer to the [Foundations](doc:foundations-doc) documentation.

Our platform provides a powerful application programming interface and documentation to help you develop secure, scalable, and high-performance applications that leverage the full breadth of capabilities offered by our backend services.

The API is founded on a pragmatic implementation of the [representational state transfer](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Representational_State_Transfer) architectural style and allows access to your organization's workforce management data using common HTTP methods and the [JSON](http://www.json.org) interchange format.
tags.name: API

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate availability pattern requests, which allow employees to temporarily override the times they are available to work.
tags.name: Employee Availability Pattern Requests

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate availability requests, which allow employees to temporarily override the times when they are available to work.
tags.name: Employee Availability Requests

tags.description: This resource allows an employee to define and submit a request for a colleague to cover a shift.
tags.name: Employee Cover Requests

tags.description: This resource allows an employee to request open shifts to work. Employees can request to select their own schedule from the times that are available when the request period is open.
tags.name: Employee Open Shift Requests

tags.description:
This resource allows you to access the employee-restricted view of an employee schedule.

Only schedule entities for the user who is currently logged in can be viewed. The employee schedule contains the same entities as the manager schedule, such as shifts, paycode edits, holidays, locked days, schedule tags, and shift transfers, but only for the current user. It also contains detailed information about each entity in the schedule. The employee schedule does not support any editing actions.
tags.name: Employee Schedules

tags.description: This resource allows an employee to create, retrieve, and update self-schedule requests. Employees can request to select their own schedule from the times that are available when the request period is open.
tags.name: Employee Self-Schedule Requests

tags.description:
Employee Self-Service (ESS) for Scheduling automates schedule processes to collect employee input, and reduces the time spent by managers in sorting, correcting, and posting final schedules. Employees use the features to request changes to their current schedules.

Refer to the [Scheduling overview](doc:scheduling-overview-doc) topic in [Domain overviews](doc:domain-overviews-doc) for more information.
tags.name: Employee Self-Service

tags.description: This resource allows an employee to define and submit a request to swap a shift with a colleague.
tags.name: Employee Swap Requests

tags.description:
This resource allows an employee to define and submit a request to be excused from regular work duties for different reasons.

If the request is approved, the system automatically incorporates the change in the schedule. All or portions of the employee's shift are replaced with the appropriate paycode. Different time-off subtypes require an open request submission period during which the employee can submit the request, providing administrative control. Depending on configuration, the employee can request time off for one day, a portion of a day, a symbolic portion of a day, multiple days or multiple portions or symbolic portions of days (whether in sequence or not). All time off requests are linked to paycodes. Different submittal and approval criteria can be defined.
tags.name: Employee Time Off Requests

tags.description: This resource allows a manager to notify employees when new open shifts are available, get their acceptance or refusal and fill the open shifts.
tags.name: Fill Open Shifts

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate availability pattern requests, which allow managers to handle requests made by employees to temporarily override the times they are available to work.
tags.name: Manager Availability Pattern Requests

tags.description: This resource allows you to retrieve and manipulate availability requests, which allow managers to handle requests made by employees to temporarily override the times when they are available to work.
tags.name: Manager Availability Requests

tags.description: This resource allows a manager to retrieve and update a shift cover request.
tags.name: Manager Cover Requests

tags.description: This resource allows a manager to retrieve and update open shift requests. Employees can request to select their own schedule from the times that are available when the request period is open.
tags.name: Manager Open Shift Requests

tags.description: This resource allows a manager to retrieve employee self-schedule requests. Employees can request to select their own schedule from the times that are available when the request period is open.
tags.name: Manager Self-Schedule Requests

tags.description: This resource allows a manager to retrieve and update a shift swap request.
tags.name: Manager Swap Requests

tags.description:
This resource allows a manager to approve, reject, or cancel time off requests submitted by an employee.

This resource also allows a manager to grant pre-approved time off to an employee. The time off has an impact on the schedule. When a manager approves a request, the system automatically incorporates the change in the schedule. All or portions of an employee's shift are replaced with the appropriate paycode. Different time-off subtypes provide administrative control and all time off requests are linked to paycodes. A manager granting preapproved time off does not require an open submission period. Depending on configuration, the manager can grant time off for one day, a portion of a day, a symbolic portion of a day, multiple days, or multiple portions or symbolic portions of days (whether in sequence or not). All time off requests are linked to paycodes. Different submittal and approval criteria can be defined.
tags.name: Manager Time Off Requests

tags.description: This resource defines the retrieval of four different guided recommendations for time off requests, grouped by team, guided recommendations, absence requests, and accruals.
tags.name: Time Off Request Guided Recommendations

post.description:
This operation creates an availability pattern request and returns the results. Once a request is submitted, it automatically transitions from the draft state to the submitted state.


The associated Access Control Points are:

  • EA_MY_AVAILABILITY
  • EA_REQUEST_COMMENTS_NOTES
  • SCHEDULE_AVAILABILITIES

parameters.description: An optional Boolean indicator of whether or not to return additional localized properties required for translation.
parameters.name: Perform-Translation

requestBody.description: The Create Availability Pattern Request request payload.

200.description: Successful creation of an availability Pattern request.

400.description: Unsuccessful creation of an availability Pattern request.

post.description:
This operation updates the state of an availability pattern request by transitioning the request from one state to another. An employee can cancel a request that employee created.


The associated Access Control Points are:

  • EA_MY_AVAILABILITY
  • EA_REQUEST_COMMENTS_NOTES
  • SCHEDULE_AVAILABILITIES

parameters.description: An optional Boolean indicator of whether or not to return additional localized properties required for translation.
parameters.name: Perform-Translation

200.description: Successfully updated an availability pattern request.

400.description: availability pattern requests update unsuccessful.

This operation invalidates a cover request posted within an evaluation time period provided to a workflow model.

The associated Access Control Point is COVER_REQUEST_INVALIDATE_API.

### Request example

The following request payload demonstrates a valid call:

```
{
    "requestId": "1262"
}

```

get.description:
This operation returns an employee's schedule according to the specified parameters.

## Service limit

A service limit constrains the number of days that can be processed in a single request.

* The __Number of Days__ cannot exceed 56,000.

Refer to the [Limits](doc:limits-doc) topic for more information.

parameters.description: Set of conditions used to find the schedule request. Valid values include "SHIFTS", "PAYCODEEDITS", "LEAVEEDITS", "AVAILABILITIES", "HOLIDAYS", "DAYLOCKS", "EMPLOYEES", "OPENSHIFTSUMMARY", "OPENSHIFTS", "SCHEDULEDAYS", "SCHEDULETAGS", "EXPANDEDJOBS", and "ONCALLFLAG".

parameters.description: Inclusive start date of the schedule date range.
parameters.name: start_date

parameters.description: Exclusive end date for the schedule date range.
parameters.name: end_date

parameters.description: Symbolic period ID associated with the schedule.
parameters.name: symbolic_period_id

parameters.description: Symbolic period name associated with the schedule.
parameters.name: symbolic_period_name

parameters.description: An ID that uniquely identifies an employee. This is not a person number.

parameters.description: A number that uniquely identifies a person. This is not an employee ID.

parameters.description: Values by which the schedule request results can be ordered.
